text: [Music]
greetings my name is Matt word I'm here
at the AWS headquarters in Seattle to
announce the general availability of s1
to increase the processing speed of
applications like genomics Research
financial analysis and video processing
developers turn to hardware acceleration
technology is like field programmable
gate arrays FPGAs have been available
for quite a while but they're still out
of reach for most developers because
they traditionally require a big
investment in dedicated on-premises
hardware to develop custom designs build
Hardware prototypes run large-scale
simulations and test and debug their
hardware accelerated codes Amazon ec2 f1
instances were specifically designed to
address this issue f1 is a new type of
compute instance that offers high
performance easy to access and fully
customizable FPGAs for developing and
deploying hardware accelerations in the
cloud with f1 instances you can directly
access custom FPGA hardware and a few
simple clicks accelerating application
performance by as much as 30 times over
general-purpose CPUs while reducing the
time and cost to develop and deploy your
own custom hardware acceleration you can
get started building your hardware
accelerations by leveraging a full set
of design tools simulators and a
hardware development kit which are all
included as part of an AWS provided FPGA
developer army using these tools you
create an Amazon FPGA image or AFI which
contains your custom FPGA design once
you've created your AFI you can deploy
it directly to an f1 instance or you can
offer your Fi to other customers by
listing it on the AWS marketplace you
can associate multiple afi's to the same
f1 instance and an instance can switch
between multiple ere files during
runtime without a reboot allowing you to
run multiple Hardware accelerations on a
single instance at the same time Amazon
ec2 f1 instances are available today in
multiple sizes and can be purchased as
either on-demand or reserved instances
that's it thanks a lot
[Music]
